```{r setup, include=TRUE, message=FALSE} 
library(hexSticker)

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

You can make awesome hex stickers for your R packages using [hexSticker](https://github.com/GuangchuangYu/hexSticker). 

# EWCE

```{r, eval=F}   
img1 <- here::here("inst/hex/cell.png")

s_size = .5
hex <- hexSticker::sticker(subplot = img1, 
                    package="E W C E", p_color="#01a8d3", p_size=30,
                    s_x = 1, s_y = .8,  s_width = s_size, s_height = s_size*.8, 
                    h_fill = "black", h_color = "#003e74",  
                    spotlight = TRUE, l_width = 8, l_height = 8,
                    white_around_sticker = FALSE,
                    filename = here::here("inst/hex/EWCE.png"))
print(hex)
```
